item.title: Mentioned by NorthumberlandView.ca
item.description:
NDP tables bill to establish a National Hockey Day
MP Linda Duncan (Edmonton – Strathcona) has tabled a Private Member's Bill calling for the establishment of a National Hockey Day. “Hockey is loved by Canadians of all ages across the country as our national winter ... It would establish the third Friday in February as National Hockey Day. “Any opportunity to interest young people in sport and shine a spotlight on the amazing bonds sport builds in our communities is a great thing,” said Official Opposition Sport critic Matthew Dubé (Chambly – Borduas). Print [P] ...

item.title: Mentioned by Globe and Mail
item.description:
Speed skater's case drawing notice in the political arena

item.title: Mentioned by Yahoo! News Canada (blog)
item.description:
Robert 'Magnum PEI' Ghiz has the better Movember nickname but trails in ...
Members of the 'Tory Mo Bros' on Parliament Hill have only collectively raised $1,730, while the 'New De-MO-crats' have raised $4,562. NDP MP Matthew Dubé leads the way with $500 in donations. [ Related: Nick Offerman's Movember mid-point advice ] ...

item.title: Mentioned by NorthumberlandView.ca
item.description:
New De-mo-crats kick off Movember in style
OTTAWA — New Democrat MP Matthew Dubé launched the NDP Movember campaign this afternoon by shaving his colleague Peter Stoffer's moustache in the House of Commons foyer. Surrounded by colleagues and NDP staff members, Dubé reiterated the ...

item.title: Mentioned by CBC.ca
item.description:
Stoffer's 'stache sacrificed again for Movember campaign
This year's team captain, Quebec MP Matthew Dubé, kicked off their efforts Thursday by shaving off Nova Scotia MP Peter Stoffer's moustache in front of the cameras in the foyer of the House of Commons. Stoffer agreed to part with his facial hair last year too, ...

item.title: Mentioned by Macleans.ca
item.description:

Outfits included Mitt Romney's “binders full of women,” Bev Oda sipping $16 OJ (albeit from a plastic container) and NDP MP Niki Ashton as Big Bird.
